hints_html:
The cross product formula can be interpreted using determinants:

\[\begin{aligned} \mathbf{u\times v}=\begin{vmatrix} \mathbf{i}&\mathbf{j}&\mathbf{k}\\ u_1&u_2&u_3\\ v_1&v_2&v_3\\ \end{vmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Use a cofactor expansion to find the determinant of a 3 by 3 matrix. Don’t forget about the sign of each factor!
hints_latex:
Use a cofactor expansion to find the determinant of a 3 by 3 matrix.
Don't forget about the sign of each factor!
hints_raw:
The cross product formula can be interpreted using determinants:

:<math>\mathbf{u\times v}=\begin{vmatrix}
\mathbf{i}&\mathbf{j}&\mathbf{k}\\
u_1&u_2&u_3\\
v_1&v_2&v_3\\
\end{vmatrix}</math>
Use a cofactor expansion to find the determinant of a 3 by 3 matrix. Don't forget about the sign of each factor!
question: A 01
sols_html:
By the cross product formula,

\[\begin{aligned} a \times b &=\begin{vmatrix} \mathbf{i}&\mathbf{j}&\mathbf{k}\\ -3&-3&3\\ 2&-3&-2\\ \end{vmatrix} \\ &= \begin{vmatrix} -3&3\\ -3&-2 \end{vmatrix}\mathbf{i} -\begin{vmatrix} -3&3\\ 2&-2 \end{vmatrix}\mathbf{j} +\begin{vmatrix} -3&-3\\ 2&-3 \end{vmatrix}\mathbf{k} \\ &= 15 \mathbf{i} - 0 \mathbf{j} + 15\mathbf{k} \\ &= \begin{bmatrix} 15 \\ 0 \\ 15 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} a = \begin{bmatrix} -3 \\ -3 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix} \qquad b = \begin{bmatrix} 2 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix} \qquad c = \begin{bmatrix} 3 \\ -4 \\ 12 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

What is \(a \times b\)?
